educational_objective: Diagnose dermatitis herpetiformis as a manifestation of celiac disease.
question_text: A 26-year-old woman has a diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome and a recent pruritic eruption on her buttocks, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is celiac disease (Option C) manifested by gastrointestinal symptoms and dermatitis herpetiformis. Dermatitis herpetiformis is characterized by grouped, pruritic, erythematous papulovesicles and erosions that typically occur over the extensor surfaces of the arms, legs, central back, buttocks, and scalp. Because of intense pruritus, erosions and excoriations are the most common clinical finding, as shown in the image below of a different patient.Almost all patients with dermatitis herpetiformis have histologic evidence of celiac disease, but gastrointestinal symptoms occur in only about 25% of patients.
